thread.title: Staggering: Timeless Ibra eclipses Messi, Ronaldo
thread.title_full: Staggering: Timeless Ibra eclipses Messi, Ronaldo

title: Staggering: Timeless Ibra eclipses Messi, Ronaldo
text:
Source: FOX SPORTS ZLATAN Ibrahimovicâ€™s importance to Manchester United cannot be understated. 
The 35-year-old has answered every question mark and silenced all the critics since his free transfer to Old Trafford last summer. 
Now it seems heâ€™s setting records and leading statistics after each match he plays in - not just proving to be the Premier Leagueâ€™s most durable star, but by eclipsing both Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldoâ€™s recent scoring records. 
While the Swedeâ€™s matchwinner against Blackburn means heâ€™s now scored in England, Italy, France and Spainâ€™s Cup competitions, it also made him the Red Devilsâ€™ highest goalscorer since the start of last season (equal with Anthony Martial on 24) despite only having joined this term. 
Zlatan has now overtaken Messi (73) and Ronaldoâ€™s (72) goal tallies over the same period with 74 goals (50 for Paris Saint-Germain). 
If that isnâ€™t enough to convince you that Ibrahimovic is â€œageing like a fine wineâ€, then consider that since turning 30, heâ€™s scored 246 goals in 300 games. 
Before he was 30 he [only] struck 232 goals in 529 games. 
Against St Etienne (on February 17, 2017), Zlatan claimed his first United hat-trick, which was the 17th of his career. Zlatan before turning 30:232 goals in 529 gamesZlatan after turning 30:246 goals in 300 gamesZlatan is like wine, better with age. pic.twitter.com/y0IGKuNV3F â€” @ManUtd_HQ (@ManUtd_HQ) February 20, 2017 
It brought up 17 goals against the French club, and his 17th goal or assist on his 17th appearance at Old Trafford. 
This week, Ibrahimovic attributed his upswing to Fabio Capello, declaring his boss at Juventus in 2004 â€œchanged my gameâ€. 
In his book I am Zlatan Ibrahimovic , he wrote that the former England manager made him regularly watch videos of Marco Van Basten and explained the importance of scoring goal after goal after goal. A post shared by IAmZlatan (@iamzlatanibrahimovic) on Feb 20, 2017 at 6:07am PST This is scary. Feb 17, 2017: Zlatan scores his 17th treble, 17th goal v St Etienne and his 17th goal/assist in 17 Old Trafford appearances ğŸ˜² pic.twitter.com/cA4Nn2Lisu â€” FOX SPORTS Football (@FOXFootballLive) February 16, 2017 
But put his scoring records to one side for a moment, and there are even more impressive figures. 
No Premier League player has played more games in all competitions this season than Ibrahimovic (36). 
That says a lot considering there were initially doubts over his durability in English football at his age. 
His form even prompted Red Devils legend Ryan Giggs to agree there are similarities between Ibrahimovic and Eric Cantona, who was nicknamed the â€˜King of Manchesterâ€™. 
â€œI think thereâ€™s similarities because of that confidence they have in their own ability and the goals that they have scored,â€ Giggs told The Mail. 
â€œIt didnâ€™t faze Eric or Ibrahimovic coming to United and being the No 1 player. 
â€œEven when they are playing well and getting all the adoration, they donâ€™t get carried away. 
â€œItâ€™s their job and you can see that he is a good professional, he is always fit and at his age to play centre-forward and to produce the goals he is producing is unbelievable.â€ 
In reality, the only thing that may be playing on Ibrahimovicâ€™s mind is ensuring his emphatic form converts into trophies with Manchester United. 36 - No Premier League player has played more games in all competitions this season than Zlatan Ibrahimovic (36). Timeless. pic.twitter.com/aUYVOI3vJl â€” OptaJoe (@OptaJoe) February 20, 2017 
Ibrahimovic has already won the Community Shield since joining United, who are still in contention for the EFL Cup (where theyâ€™ll face Southampton in the final), FA Cup, Europa League. Realistically, their PL ambition is to reclaim a top four spot. 
Even though heâ€™s already lifted almost 20 club trophies and countless individual awards, itâ€™s obvious that his desire to win more hasnâ€™t diminished at the end of his career. 
After the Europa League win last week, Ibrahimovic emphasised that by comparing himself with fictional archaeologist and adventurer Indiana Jones. Zlatan gifted by St Etienne 0:41 
â€œEvery trophy for me is incredible, everywhere I came I won so if I can win something here I will be super happy,â€ he said. 
â€œPeople that know me know that I play in many clubs and I try to do my best. 
â€œWherever I went I won, so I am like Indiana Jones.â€ 
Perhaps the whole United squad can take something from his 10 secrets to success and happiness that he shared in 10 video clips on the clubâ€™s Instagram feed. Ibrahimovic shoots from the penalty spot to score against St Etienne. Source: AFP 
10 COMMANDMENTS TO â€˜DARE TO ZLATANâ€™ 
1. â€œSmile because you make other people happy and you look happy. But the smile needs to be a real smile.â€ 
2. â€œEnjoy life, because life can be short, can be long, but make sure you enjoy it because life is beautiful.â€ 
3. â€œDonâ€™t be too serious because if youâ€™re always serious, people may think something different about you. Make sure you joke, smile, have fun, give people energy.â€ 
4. â€œPractice, practice and practice because without practice, you cannot become what you want in whatever you want.â€ 
5. â€œWork hard because when you work hard, everything comes back to you. For whatever you want to be, work hard because it shouldnâ€™t be easy, because we donâ€™t like it the easy way, we like it the hard way.â€ Ibrahimovic in a training session. Source: AFP 
6. â€œMaster your man stare. I have mine, make sure you find yours. Like this, people will be afraid of you.â€ 
7. â€œWhy do it normal? Why do it more than normal? Do it brilliant. We want to be brilliant in whatever we do because people remember brilliant.â€ 
8. â€œWhatever happens, your family will always be there. So make sure you take care of your family from day one until the end because theyâ€™re the important ones. Whatever anyone else says is not important but what your family says is very important.â€ 
9. â€œHave respect and gain respect. Once I learned in my life, when I met Fabio Capello, he said to me, â€˜You donâ€™t ask for respect, you get your respect.â€™ Make sure you also get your respect.â€ 
10. â€œIn whatever you do, you need to believe in yourself and you need to have confidence for what you are doing, or else it will be very difficult.â€ Zlatan Ibrahimovic of Manchester United celebrates with a fan.
